intro: Croton jacmelianus, commonly known as the Jacmelian croton, is a tropical plant native to parts of Central and South America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its large, palmate leaves that can reach up to 30 cm in diameter. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically green or yellow in color. The plant is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its striking foliage.
